Github Documentation Blog 1-minute demo

How?

  1. List your pipeline task (scripts) in a pipeline.yaml file
  2. Inside each script, declare an upstream variable to state dependencies (other scripts)
  3. Declare a product to declare output files (that the next script will use as inputs)

That's it!

Why?

Once you structure your pipeline this way, Ploomber can do a lot of things for you, here are some of them:

  1. Automated end-to-end-testing
  2. Sync teamwork
  3. Incremental builds (skip up-to-date tasks)
  4. Task parallelization

Integration with Jupyter

Ploomber does not compromise structure with interactivity, a Jupyter extension allows your scripts to be rendered as notebooks paths to inputs be automatically added based on your declared task dependencies.
